text: Albert Wolfgang, Count of Schaumburg-Lippe Albrecht Wolfgang, Count of Schaumburg-Lippe (27 April 1699 – 24 September 1748) was a ruler of the County of Schaumburg-Lippe. ==Biography== He was born in Bückeburg the son of Friedrich Christian, Count of Schaumburg-Lippe and his first wife, Countess Johanna Sophia of Hohenlohe-Langenburg (1673–1743). He succeeded his father as Count on 13 June 1728. In 1743, he joined Maria Theresa of Austria and Schaumburg-Lippe led during the War of the Austrian Succession. He died at Bückeburg and was succeeded as Count by his son Wilhelm. ==Marriages and children== He was married firstly to Countess Margarete Gertrud of Oeynhausen (1701–1726), an illegitimate daughter of George I of Great Britain and his mistress Ehrengard Melusine von der Schulenburg, on 30 October 1721 at London. They had two children: *Count Georg Wilhelm (1722–1742), killed in a duel at age 20 *Count Wilhelm (1724–1777) He was married secondly to Princess Charlotte of Nassau-Siegen (1702–1785) on 26 April 1730 at Varel. She was the eldest daughter of Frederick William Adolf, Prince of Nassau-Siegen. He had at least two illegitimate sons: August Wolfrath von Campen, who married Countess Wilhelmine von Anhalt, morganatic daughter of Prince William Gustav of Anhalt- Dessau; and, with Charlotte Sophie of Aldenburg, Karl Wilhelm Wolfgang von Donop, father of historian Georg von Donop. ==References== ==External links== *Schaumburg-Lippe Nobility Category:1699 births Category:1748 deaths Category:People from Bückeburg Category:Counts of Lippe Category:House of Lippe Category:People from Schaumburg-Lippe
title: Albert Wolfgang, Count of Schaumburg-Lippe
